m64tweak.name: Time for...
m64tweak.description: Time values are in frames. 30 frames is 001E, or 1 second in 30fps. 60 frames is 003C, or 1 second in 60fps. So multiply the amount of seconds you want by the framerate of the game (default is 30 unless you apply Kaze's 60fps). Then, add 0s to the beginning until you get a 2 byte value.
